body_html:
@fmassa we can still use a variable number of ints. So can you update that part please Richard? Thanks!
…
On Sat, Apr 14, 2018 at 04:13 Francisco Massa ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. ------------------------------ In torch/_torch_docs.py <#6594 (comment)>: > @@ -5719,14 +5719,25 @@ add_docstr(torch.zeros, r""" -zeros(*sizes, out=None) -> Tensor +zeros(size, out=None, dtype=None, layout=torch.strided, device=None, requires_grad=False) -> Tensor Is the tuple a requirement (I.e., a breaking change), or can we still pass variable number of ints? I'm not mentioning we should change the doc, but it's for my understanding actually :-) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#6594 (review)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFaWZcqGiUZrog8HsmRkVIu3Rq4iuvn0ks5toa-WgaJpZM4TT4VH> .
body_text:
@fmassa we can still use a variable number of ints. So can you update that
part please Richard? Thanks!
…
On Sat, Apr 14, 2018 at 04:13 Francisco Massa ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In torch/_torch_docs.py
 <#6594 (comment)>:

 > @@ -5719,14 +5719,25 @@

  add_docstr(torch.zeros,
             r"""
 -zeros(*sizes, out=None) -> Tensor
 +zeros(size, out=None, dtype=None, layout=torch.strided, device=None, requires_grad=False) -> Tensor

 Is the tuple a requirement (I.e., a breaking change), or can we still pass
 variable number of ints? I'm not mentioning we should change the doc, but
 it's for my understanding actually :-)

 —

body:
@fmassa we can still use a variable number of ints. So can you update that
part please Richard? Thanks!

On Sat, Apr 14, 2018 at 04:13 Francisco Massa <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@fmassa* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In torch/_torch_docs.py
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/6594#discussion_r181545555>:
>
> > @@ -5719,14 +5719,25 @@
>
>  add_docstr(torch.zeros,
>             r"""
> -zeros(*sizes, out=None) -> Tensor
> +zeros(size, out=None, dtype=None, layout=torch.strided, device=None, requires_grad=False) -> Tensor
>
> Is the tuple a requirement (I.e., a breaking change), or can we still pass
> variable number of ints? I'm not mentioning we should change the doc, but
> it's for my understanding actually :-)
>
